author: Melissa Korn
title: Larry Nassar’s Boss at Michigan State Said in 2016 That He Didn’t Believe Sex Abuse Claims
text:
Larry Nassar’s longtime boss at Michigan State University told a group of students and administrators in the fall of 2016 that he did not believe female patients who alleged repeated sexual abuse by the former U.S. national gymnastics team doctor, according to two people who said they heard the comments.
William Strampel, who was dean of the osteopathic medical school from 2002 until he stepped down for medical reasons late last year, also indicated that he had not wanted to fire Dr. Nassar two weeks earlier, these people... RELATED VIDEO Aly Raisman Calls for an Independent Investigation of the USOC U.S. Olympic Gold Medalist Aly Raisman blasted the USOC and USA Gymnastics in a Lansing, Mich., courtroom before the sentencing of former team doctor Larry Nassar.
